TRPG.JS

TRPG.JS is a library that can be used to build web-based TRPGs.

What is TRPG?
Tabletop Role-Playing Game, where multiple players need to follow a set of rules, role-play their characters, and go through a story together.

You can use TRPG.JS library to display the information panel for each player, such as attributes, skills, talent tree and inventory, as well as to display events and the possible options or reactions to the events.

Getting Started

This library is built by vanilla JavaScript, no external module is required.
Simply include the following two lines in the HTML <head> tag. 

<link rel="stylesheet" href="TRPG.css">
<script src="TRPG.js"> </script>

Attribute Panel

A panel simply displays the attributes’ names and values.

  • customize each attribute’s value and description
  • hover on any attribute to see its description
  • customize the display style of the entire object

Try it on Play Ground

Example

HTML:

<div id="attribute-panel"> </div>

JavaScript:

const aPanel = new AttributePanel(
    // first parameter: element ID
    'attribute-panel', {
    // second parameter: configurations
        // required configuration: attribute names and values
        attributes : {
            hp: 1000,
            mp: 500,
            sanity: 'healthy',
            career: 'web developer'
          },
        // optional configurations: description
        description : {
            hp: 'heath point, you will lose health when 
                you eat a rotten apple :)'
        },
        showDescription : true
  });

API Functions

These functions can be used directly without re-rendering the object.
Example: 

aPanel.delete("sanity");
Function Type Usage Example
set(attribute,value) attribute: String , value: String/Number Add or modify an attribute set("life", 13)
delete(attribute) attribute: String remove an attribute delete("life")
setNameColor(attribute, color) attribute: String , color: String displays the name text of the given attribute in given color setNameColor("hp", "red")
setValueColor(attribute, color) attribute: String, color: String displays the value text of the given attribute in given color setValueColor("hp", "red")
setDescription(attribute, description) attribute: String , description: String add or modify the discription of an attribute setDescription("life","the game ends when your life goes to 0")
update() - re-render the object update()

Configurations

Function update() is required for the following configurations to be effective.
Example: 

aPanel.showDescription = true;
aPanel.showDescriptionWhenHoverOn = "both";
aPanel.update();
Name Type Default Description
attributes Object {} required for initialization. Format : {attribute_name: attribute_value}
description Object {} the descriptions of each attribute. Format: {attribute_name: attribute_description}
showDescription Bool true enable or disable the ability to show description when hover on the elements
showDescriptionWhenHoverOn "name"/"value"/"both" "name" decide when the user hovers on which elements to display the descriptions
colorChange Bool false enable or disable the ability to change text color when the attribute changes
colorChangeTime Number or "inf" 3 decide the time interval of the text color change
colorChangeColor String "red" decide the color of the text color change
nameColor String "black" set the color of all attribute names. This will not overwrite setNameColor function.
valueColor String "black" set the color of all attribute values. This will not overwrite setValueColor function.
nameTextAlign "left"/"center"/"right" "right" set the alignment of all attribute names
valueTextAlign "left"/"center"/"right" "left" set the alignment of all attribute values

Attribute Bars

Upgrade of the Attribute Panel, displays the attributes in a graphical way.

  • customize each attribute’s current value, maximum value, bar color and description
  • hover on any attribute to see its description
  • customize the display style of the entire object

Try it on Play Ground

Example

HTML:

<div id="attribute-bar"> </div>

JavaScript:

const aBar = new AttributeBars(
    // first parameter: element ID
    'attribute-bar', {
    // second parameter: configurations
        // required configuration: attribute names, values and bar colors
        preset_attributes : {  
            hp: [1000,2000,'pink'],
            mp: [500,800,'rgb(155, 198, 255)']
          },
        // optional configurations: description
        description : {
            hp: 'heath point, you will lose health when 
                you eat a rotten apple :)',
            mp: 'the thing we all need to cast a spell'
        },
        showDescription : true
  });

API Functions

These functions can be used directly without re-rendering the object.
Example: 

aBar.delete("hp");
Function Type Usage Example
set(attribute, value, maxValue, barColor) attribute: String,value: Number, maxValue: Number, barColor: String add or modify an attribute by inputing the attribute name, current value, max value and bar color set("life", 3, 5, "pink")
delete(attribute) attribute: String remove an attribute delete("hp")
setValue(attribute, value) attribute: String, value: Number modify an existing attribute’s value setValue("life", 1)
setMaxValue(attribute, value) attribute: String, value: Number modify an existing attribute’s max value setMaxValue("life", 100)
setBarColor(attribute, color) attribute: String, color: String modify the bar color of an attribute setBarColor("life", "red")
setLabelColor(attribute, color) attribute: String, color: String modify the text label color of an attribute setLabelColor("life", "white")
setDescription(attribute, description) attribute: String, description: String add or modify the description of an attribute setDescription("life", "don't waste it")
update() - re-render the object update()

Configurations

Function update() is required for the following configurations to be effective.
Example: 

aBar.showDescription = true;
aBar.descriptionPosition = "center";
aBar.update();
Name Type Default Description
preset_attributes object {} for initialization only. Format : {attribute_name: [value, max_value, bar_color]}
attributes object {} current value of each attributes. Format : {attribute_name: attribute_value}
attributesMax object {} max value of each attributes. Format : {attribute_name: attribute_max_value}
barColor object {} bar color of each attributes. Format : {attribute_name: bar_color}
labelColors object {} the text label color of each attribute, and it overrides the configuration labelColor. Format : {attribute_name: bar_color}
description object {} the description of each attribute. Format: {attribute_name: attribute_description}
showDescription Bool true enable or disable the ability to show desciption when hover on the elements
descriptionPosition "left" or "center" or "right" "center" decide the postion of the description
colorChange Bool false enable or disable the ability to change text label color when the attribute changes
colorChangeTime Number or "inf" 3 decide the time interval of the text color change
colorChangeColor String "red" decide the color of the text color change
showLabel Bool true enable or disable the abilitiy to display the text label
labelColor String "black" set the text label color of all attribute names. This will not overwrite setNameColor function.
labelStyle "value/max"or"value"or"%" "value/max" choose which way to display the text label
containerColor String "rgb(216, 216, 216)" set the background color of all bars
allowExceedMax Bool false allow the current value exceeds the max value numerically

Inventory

A table-like container for players to deal with their items.

  • customize each item’s description, icon image, options and each option’s onclick function
  • hover on any item to see its description
  • click on any item to see available options
  • customize the style of the inventory

Try it on Play Ground

Example

HTML:

<div id="inventory"> </div>

JavaScript:

const myBag = new Inventory(
    // first parameter: element ID
    'inventory', {
    // second parameter: configurations
        // required configuration: item names and quantities
        quantity : { apple: 20,banana: 5,
                   orange: 0,strawberry: 100},
        // optional configurations: description
        description: { apple: 'rotted',
               banana: 'it tastes like a banana' }, 
        // optional configurations: image path
        image: { apple: //path to image here},
        // optional configurations: row number and column number
        numRow: 4,
        numColumn: 6,
        // optional configurations: left click menu options and their onclick event functions
        menuOption: ['use','destroy'],
        menuOptionOnclick: { 'use': use_item,
         'destroy':  destroy_item,}  
});

API Functions

These functions can be used directly without re-rendering the object.
Example: 

myBag.addItem("apple", 10);
Function Type Usage Example
set(item, quantity, description, image_path) item: String, quantity: Number, description: String, image_path: String add or modify an item set("blueberry", 20, "my favourite", "image/blueberry.jpg")
setQuantity(item, quantity) item: String, quantity: Number modify an item’s quantity setQuantity("blueberry, 100)
setDescription(item, description) item: String, description:String add or modify an item’s description setDescription("blueberry", "I don't like it any more")
setImage(item, image_path) item: String, image_path: String add or modify an item’s image icon setImage("blueberry", "image/trashBin.jpg")
addItem(item, quantity) item: String, quantity: Number add an item by quantity addItem("banana", 10)
removeItem(item, quantity) item: String, quantity: Number remove an item by quantity removeItem("blueberry", 20)
clearItem(item) item: String remove all of the given item removeItem("blueberry")
setOption(options) options: Array set a list of options on the left click menu for each item setOption(["eat", "play", "wash"])
addOption(option) option: String add an option on the left click menu addOption("drink")
addOptionClick(option, func) option: String, func: a function takes item's name as input add or modify an option’s onclick event function addOptionClick("eat", eat_item), where we can define function eat_item(item) { myBag.removeItem(item, 1); }
removeOptionClick(option) option: String remove an option from the left click menu removeOptionClick("wash")
update() - re-render the object update()

Configurations

Function update() is required for the following configurations to be effective.
Example: 

myBag.showDescription = true;
myBag.update();
Name Type Default Description
quantity object {} quantity for each item, required for initialization. Format : {item_name: item_quantity}
description object {} description for each item. Format : {item_name: item_description}
image object {} image path for each item. Format : {item_name: item_image_path}
numRow Number 5 number of rows
numColumn Number 5 number of columns
showName Bool TRUE enable or disable the ability to display item names when hover on any item
showDescription Bool TRUE enable or disable the ability to display item descriptions when hover on any item
showQuantity Bool TRUE enable or disable the ability to display quantity label
showOnclickMenu Bool TRUE enable or disable the ability to display onclick menu when left click on any item
menuOption Array [] the list of options on the left click menu
menuOptionOnclick object {} the onclick functions of each option. The onclick function will be stored even if the option is not in menuOption array.
optionFontSize Number in px 20 the font size of options on the left click menu
itemSize Number in px 50 the width and height of each item
quantityFontSize Number in px 18 the font size of the quantity text label
quantityXPosition "left"/"center"/"right" "right" the horizontal position of the quantity text label
quantityYPosition "top"/"center"/"bottom" "bottom" the vertical position of the quantity text label

Event List

A window displays an event and its options.

  • customize each event’s description, options, each option’s onclick function
  • show a specific event by its name
  • show a random event

Try it on Play Ground

Example

HTML:

<div id="event-list"> </div>

JavaScript:

const eList = new EventList(
    // first parameter: element ID
   'event-list', {
    // second parameter: configurations
          // events and their options
          events : {  
            'golden apple': ['pick up','cancel'],
            'pikachu': ['fight', 'run'],
            'an event without description':
                  ['an option without description','cancel']
          },
          // events and their descriptions
          eventDescription: {
            'golden apple': `There is a golden apple on the ground,
                   and no creatures is guarding it nearby. When you 
                   approach, you smell a scent that you can't resist.`,
            'pikachu': "A wild Pikachu appears!"
          },
          // options and their onclick functions
          options: {
            'cancel': cancel,
            'run': run,
            'fight': fight
          },
          // options and their descriptions
          optionDescription: {
            'run': "I'm not strong enough, it's time to escape!",
            'fight': "Escape is for coward, I'd fight till death!",
            'pick up': "It's mine now! [Pick Up]"
          }
});

API Functions

These functions can be used directly.
Example: 

eList.showRandom();
Function Type Usage Example
show(event_name) event_name: String display a certain event show("golden apple")
showRandom() - display a random event showRandom()
showRandomWithoutRepeat() - display a random event without repeating the previous one showRandomWithoutRepeat()
setEvent(event_name, options, description) event_name: String,options: Array, description: String add or modify an event. Will display this event setEvent("pikachu", ["fight", "pet"], "You see a Pikachu in your bathroom")
setOption(option_name, click_function, description) option_name: String, click_function: function, description: String add or modify an option setOption("fight", fight, "I don't like it, so I will fight it")
deleteEvent(event_name) event_name: String delete an event. If currently displayed event is deleted, then will display the first event deleteEvent("golden apple")
addEventOption(event_name, option_name) event_name: String, option_name: String add an option to an event addEventOption("pikachu", "escape")
deleteEventOption(event_name, option_name) event_name: String, option_name: String delete an option from an event deleteEventOption("pikachu", "pet")
setOptionOnclick(option_name, click_function) option_name: String, click_function: function add or modify an option’s onclick function setOptionOnclick("escape", escape)
setOptionDescription(option_name, description) option_name: String, description: String add or modify an option’s description setOptionDescription("escape", "I'm too weak, I just want to run away")

Configurations

Function show(event_name) or showRandom() is required for the following configurations to be effective.
Example: 

eList.events["lecture"] = ["taking notes", "sleeping"];
eList.eventDescription["lecture"] = "Now it's lecture time";
eList.options["taking notes"] = take_note; 
eList.show("lecture");

function take_note() {
    console.log("I'm taking notes...");
}
Name Type Default Description
events object {} events and their options. Format: {event_name: [options]}
eventDescription object {} events and their descriptions. If an event has no description, then will display the event name directly. Format: {event_name: description}
options object {} options and their onclick functions. Format: {option_name: onclick_function}
optionDescription object {} options and their descriptions. If an option has no description, then will display the option name directly. Format: {option_name: description}

Skill Panel

A panel displays the skills.

  • customize each skill’s description, cooldown, onclick function and icon image
  • show description when hover on any skill
  • show cooldown countdown after click on any skill
  • disable a skill when it’s in cooldown
  • enable a skill when the cooldown ends

Example

Try it on Play Ground
HTML: 

<div id="skill-panel"> </div>

JavaScript:

const sPanel = new SkillPanel(
    // first parameter: element ID
    'skill-panel', {
        // second parameter: configurations
          skills: ['attack','retreat'],
          icon: {
            'attack': "img/stick.png",
            'retreat': "img/escape.jpg",
          },
          description: {
            attack:'normal attack <br><br> damage: 1 <br> <i> better than escape</i>',
            retreat: "it's a situational retreat "
          },
          onclick: {
            attack: attack,
            retreat: retreat,
          },
          cooldown: {
            retreat: 5,
          }
});

API Functions

These functions can be used directly without re-rendering the object.

Function Type Usage Example
setSkill(name, description, cooldown, icon_path, click) name: String, description:String, cooldown:Number in sec, icon_path: String, click: function add or modify a skill with its name, description, cool down, icon image path and onclick function setSkill("attack", "normal attack", "img/attack.jpg", attack)
addSkill(name) name: String add a skill to the panel. If the skill is already on the panel, it will not be added. addSkill("sing")
deleteSkill(name) name: String remove a skill from the panel. This will not remove the skill’s information deleteSkill("sing")
enableSkill(name) name: String enable a skill enableSkill("sing")
disableSkill(name) name: String disable a skill, it will be unclickable disableSkill("sing")
update() - re-render the object update()

Configurations

Function update() is required for the following configurations to be effective.

Name Type Default Description
skills Array [] the names of the skills you want to display on the panel
icon object {} the icon image path of each skill.Format: {name: img_path}
description object {} the description of each skill. Format: {name: description}
onclick object {} the onclick function of each skill. Format:{name: onclick_function}
cooldown object {} the cooldown of each skill. Format: {name: cooldown}
disabled object {} the disable state of each skill. Format: {name: true/false}
iconSize Number in px 80 the width and height of each skill
showDescription Bool true decide show or not show the description when hover on each skill
timerColor String "black" the text color of the counting down number
